content.description: start with right hand on slopey pinch on the lowest right hold of the arete and left hand on a small crimp side pull.  High left foot and pull on and make a left hand move to a good smooth hold.  Match this and traverse left to the jug of righteous chaplin and top out same as righteous chaplin.
content.protection: more pads the better, build up the landing if possible since its rocky and slopes away

content.description: Contender for one of the, if not the best V3 in Rhode Island! Start standing with right hand in lower bomber part of crack and left in higher chalked up part. Sit start is V5 and shares same right hand hold.
content.location: Right off Mary Mowry trail in Wolf Hill Forest Preserve on the way to the quarry wall.

content.description: This is the early exit of smooth crimpinal.  Start as for SC, but once you get to gaston move just move straight up and top out instead of continuing left to meet up with RC top out

There are a couple different sections along a single trail that curves to the back of the quarry. The main section of ice is all the way in the back, along the left side of the trail (heading in). There's some pretty good variation if it's in, which takes a lot of cold.

 The rock is generally horrible and loose, and "not climbable" unless iced up, though there is some bouldering.
